intro: Micranthes saximontana, commonly known as the mountain micranthus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of North America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its leaves are narrow and often have a bluish or silver-gray hue due to a dense covering of trichomes. Micranthes saximontana is adapted to cold climates and can thrive in harsh, high-altitude environments.
